meanings.definition: To turn or rotate the hand or foot so that the palm or sole is facing upward or forward.
meanings.sent1: She supinated her hand to show the correct way to hold the cup.
meanings.sent2: He supinated his foot to stretch his calf muscles.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor supinated her hand with a flourish, as if presenting a gift.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements were so graceful, it seemed as if she supinated the air around her.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic demonstrated how to supinate the wrench for better leverage.

meanings.definition: Having the palm or sole facing upward or forward.
meanings.sent1: The supinated position of her hand made it easier to carry the tray.
meanings.sent2: The cat stretched out in a supinated pose, basking in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The supinated shoes made him feel like he was walking on clouds.
meanings.sent4: The supinated leaves of the plant reached eagerly towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The supinated grip on the handlebar gave her better control of the bike.
